is_undefined: This function returns whether a given variable is defined or not. In some cases you want to check and see what data type a variable holds in GameMaker Studio 2 and that's when you would use this function. It returns <tt>true</tt> or <tt>false</tt> depending on whether the value is defined or not.
NOTE: This function cannot be used to verify the existence of a variable. Use variable_instance_exists() or variable_global_exists() instead.

{ANY_CODE} var val = ds_map_find_value(map, 13);
if is_undefined(val)
{nbsp_x4}{
{nbsp_x4}show_debug_message("Map entry does not exist!");
{nbsp_x4}}
The above code checks the variable "val" to see if it is undefined or not and shows a debug message if it is.
